Policies

Services

Brow Pre Appointment Download

Contraindications:

Any type of semi-permanent or permanent makeup is NOT recommended for any clients who are or have:

  • People with glaucoma and those who are taking blood thinning medicines
  • Chemotherapy (consult your doctor)
  • Diabetic (consult your doctor)
  • Keloid Disorder
  • Viral infections and/or diseases
  • Pacemaker or major heart problems
  • Organ transplant
  • Epilepsy
  • Skin irritations or psoriasis/eczema near the treated area (rashes, sunburn, acne, etc)
  • Botox within the past 4 weeks
  • Pregnant or nursing
  • Those with allergies to makeup, colors, or hairdye
  • Those with easily triggered post inflammatory hyper pigmentation are not good candidates
  • Those with transmittable blood conditions like HIV or Hepatitis
  • Are a Hemophiliac
  • Have healing disorders, on blood thinners, uncontrolled high blood pressure, or had Mitral Valve Disorder
  • Those on any skin medication such as ro-accutaine or steroids which thin and over sensitize the skin.
  • AHA's (lactic, glycolic, citric, retinoic, and tartaric acids) or any OTC creams and lotions for tone correcting, anti-aging, exfoliating, fading can discolor your permanent makeup.
  • Coumadin: Amount of bleeding and response to topical epinephrine will determine coverage per appointment. If excessive bleeding occurs, extra appointments may be necessary for desired outcome or procedure may not be effective.
  • Cancers/Chemotherapy: Doctor's clearance may be necessary.
  • Juvederm or other "fillers": in the past 4 weeks.
  • Shingles (varicella): If you have shingles on your face, wait several months to get permanent makeup.
  • Eyelift or Blepharoplasty: Wait about 3 months.

How to prepare for your appointment:

  • If you have an ideal shape or color in mind, bring those reference photos with you to your appointment. You may also fill in your eyebrows as you normally would to share your desired outcome. If you regularly get your eyebrows waxed or threaded, please do so 72 hours before your service.
  • Clients must avoid any blood thinning medications for a minimum of 72 hours prior to appointment. This includes Vitamin E, Aspirin, Niacin, fish oil supplements, Advil, and Ibuprofen. Tylenol is okay.
  • No working out the day of your appointment.
  • No alcohol drinks 24-48 hours prior to your service.
  • No caffeine 24 hours prior to your service.
  • No Botox, fillers, or chemical peel facials within 4 weeks.
  • It is highly advised that you avoid sun and tanning bed exposure for 30 days before and after your treatment. If you show up for your appointment with a recent tan or sunburn, you will be asked to reschedule resulting in loss of deposit. Excessive sun exposure before and/or after your treatment may cause the eyebrows to fade into a lighter ashy hue.
  • If you have a previous eyebrow tattoo or Microblading, please email a photo for approval prior to scheduling a service. Email: booking@mariaelenapmu.com

What to expect after your appointment:

  • Immediately following the appointment, the tattooed area will appear to be dark,slightly bold in color and more sharply defined. Do not apply any cosmetics in this area for 14 days. If your skin starts to feel tight/dry around day 3-4, you may use a small amount of the aftercare ointment provided to you. Oily skin clients are asked to blot the eyebrow area every2-3 hours with blotting paper until fully healed. Please be sure to follow all aftercare instructions provided to you.
  • During the healing period, there may be some flaking of the skin. This is completely normal. If there is some flaking, please do not pick, pull or rub. Allow the flakes to come off on their own. This process can take up to 2 weeks. IMPORTANT: Once the flakes have fallen off, a shiny layer of healing skin will completely cover the tattooed area. It may appear as though the tattoo has completely disappeared or lightened. Within 1-2 weeks, the color will slowly reappear at a lighter shade as your skin regenerates.
  • The complete healing process takes approximately 6 weeks, at which time the true color of the tattoo is evident. During this process, your tattoo will soften/lighten. Be patient, even if you think too much color has been lost.Keep in mind that the skin regenerates between 18-45 days, your skin will need time to fully heal. Be sure to follow up with your 6-8 week touch up.

Aftercare:

  • Don not apply any makeup on the tattooed area for 2 weeks.
  • Cosmetics of any kind will interfere with the healing and color of your eyebrows.
  • Avoid heavy sweating, gym, and working out for 7-10 days following your procedure.
  • No swimming pools, jacuzzi, or other bodies of water for 2 weeks.
  • Do not tint, bleach, dye, or perform a row lamination for 4 weeks following your procedure.
  • Do not use oils, Vaseline, Neosporin, or other petroleum based products during the healing process.
  • Do not apply any anti-acne products (e.g. Benzoyl Peroxide, Salicylic Acid, Proactiv, etc.) or lightening creams, such as hydroquinone to the treated area while healing.
  • You may continue your regular skincare routine after 30 days. This includes Botox, fillers, and facial treatments.
  • If you are having laser resurfacing or laser hair removal after your tattoo has healed, please inform the laser technician. Laser procedures may darken, lighten, or discolor the tattooed area (continue at your own discretion).

Permanent EyeLiner Services Download

Permanent Eyeliner is a cosmetic tattoo, which allows your top lashes to have a more full and darker effect by simply outlining and framing the eye. The goal at the end of this process is to allow the permanent eyeliner to sit directly on the top lash line, blending into the top lashes. The Permanent Eyeliner Services give room for advantages such as: no smudging, will always have its beautifully drawn shape, and it cuts down on daily makeup routines.

How to Prepare for Your Appointment:

  • Do not take any blood thinning medication 72 hours prior to the appointment time. These medications include: Vitamin E, Aspirin, Niacin, Fish Oil, Advil, and Ibuprofen. If medication is needed for pain at all during those 72 hours prior to appointment time, it is fine to take Tylenol.
  • If you wear contacts daily, they will need to be removed when it is time for the procedure, and they cannot be worn again for 2-3 weeks after your tattoo.
  • If you have eyelash extensions, they should be removed before coming in for your appointment. Eyelash extensions affect the tattooing process and the healing process.
  • If you use any serums for lash growth, you should stop within 2 weeks before your scheduled appointment, and you must not use it again until 30 post appointment.
  • NO exercises the day of your appointment or for 7-10 days after.
  • NO alcoholic beverages 24-48 hours prior to scheduled appointment time.

Eyeliner Aftercare:

  • If there is swelling, ice for 15 minutes every hour after your treatment for a 4-hour time span.
  • DO NOT put makeup on the area that was tattooed for 2 weeks after the procedure. Cosmetics can interfere with how the area tattooed heals along with the color.
  • No swimming, Jacussis, hot tubs, or any large body of water for 2 weeks after the procedure.
  • Avoid applying anti-acne products or lightening creams while the treated area goes through healing.
  • Once the tattooed area is healed, it is important and recommended that you throw away your old mascara and buy a new tube.

What do I need to expect after my appointment?

  • During the healing stages, there should be some flaking of the skin in that specific area. If peeling/flaking does appear, please do not touch, pull, or rub those places. It is important to let those places flake on their own as it could cause the skin and color to heal incorrectly. (This could take up to 2 weeks.)
  • The overall healing period can last up to 6 weeks. When those six weeks are up, the color should now be healed to it's true color targeted for.
  • If a few weeks have gone by, and you feel that you have lost a lot of your color, do not worry because your skin must go through the complete healing period before you get that final and desired color.
  • ALWAYS book your follow up appointment between 6-8 weeks!

If You have Any of These, it is Not Recommended for you to acquire Permanent Makeup:

  • Glaucoma and anyone who is taking blood thinning medications.
  • Chemotherapy (talk to your doctor first)
  • Diabetes (talk to your doctor first).
  • Keloid Disorder
  • Any kind of viral infections or diseases.
  • Pacemaker or any kind of heart threatening problems.
  • Organ Transplant
  • Epilepsy
  • Skin irritations or eczema near the treated area (rashes, sunburn, acne).
  • If you've had Botox within the past 4 weeks before your appointment.
  • If you are pregnant or nursing.
  • If you have allergies, and are allergic to makeup, colors, or hairdye.
  • Those with easily triggered post inflammatory hyper pigmentation.
  • Transmittable blood conditions (HPV or Hepatitis).
  • Hemophiliac.
  • Healing problems, uncontrolled high blood pressure, or mitral valve disorder.
  • Those using any skin medication that causes thinning and irritation of the skin.
  • AHA's or any OTC creams and lotions that are used to tone correct, anti-aging, and exfoliate. These things could cause fading and discoloration in your permanent makeup tattoo.
  • Coumadin: depending on the amount of bleeding and how your skin responds to topical epinephrine, will determine how much coverage the tattoo will be able to cover per session. If one tends to bleed during the procedure, they may have to come for a few extra appointments to make sure the color is taking.
  • If one has had an eyelift or blepharoplasty, it is important to wait 3 months before scheduling to come in for permanent eyeliner.
  • If one has Pinkeye and wants to make an appointment, they must wait until they are completely healed and taken all of their prescribed medication before scheduling an appointment.
